Description: AWS CloudFormation Sample Template cfncluster.cfn.json: Sample template showing an framework for deploying master + compute type clusters on AWS.  **WARNING** This template creates AWS resources. You will be billed for the AWS resources used if you create a stack from this template. Version: ami-20150803-3 cfncluster-0.0.22

KeyName.Description: Name of an existing EC2 KeyPair to enable SSH access to the instances

MasterInstanceType.ConstraintDescription: must be a valid EC2 instance type.

ComputeInstanceType.ConstraintDescription: must be a valid EC2 instance type.

SpotComputeInstanceType.ConstraintDescription: must be a valid EC2 instance type.

InitialQueueSize.Description: Inital number of EC2 instances to launch as compute nodes in the cluster.

MaxQueueSize.Description: Maximum number of EC2 instances that can be launched in the cluster.

ComputeSubnetId.Description: ID of the Subnet you want to provision the Compute Servers into

ScalingThreshold.Description: Threshold for triggering CloudWatch ScaleUp action

ScalingEvaluationPeriods.Description: Number of periods consective periods required to trigger the scaling adjustment

ScalingPeriod.Description: Period in seconds to measure ScalingThreshold

ClusterType.Description: Type of cluster to launch i.e. ondemand or spot
ClusterType.ConstraintDescription: must be a supported cluster type

ProxyServer.Description: hostname and port of HTTP proxy server for cfn-init, boto and yum i.e. proxy.example.com:8080

VolumeSize.Description: Size of EBS volume in GB, if creating a new one

VolumeType.Description: Type of volume to create either new or from snapshot
VolumeType.ConstraintDescription: must be a supported volume type: standard, io1, gp2

MasterSubnetId.Description: ID of the Subnet you want to provision the Master server into

AvailabilityZone.Description: Availability Zone the cluster will launch into. THIS IS REQUIRED

EBSSnapshotId.Description: Id of EBS snapshot if using snapshot as source for volume

CustomAMI.Description: ID of a Custom AMI, to use instead of published AMI's

VPCId.Description: ID of the VPC you want to provision cluster into. Only used with UseVPCBase=false

SSHFrom.Description: Lockdown SSH access (default can be accessed from anywhere)
SSHFrom.ConstraintDescription: must be a valid CIDR range of the form x.x.x.x/x.

ComputeSubnetCidr.Description: CIDR(s) for new backend subnet(s) i.e. 10.0.100.0/24. This is a comma-delimited list and can support multiple CIDR ranges for a multi-AZ cluster. The order and length of this list MUST match the AvailabilityZones parameter.
ComputeSubnetCidr.ConstraintDescription: must be a valid CIDR range of the form x.x.x.x/x.

MaintainInitialSize.Description: Boolean flag to set autoscaling group to maintain initial size and scale back

UsePublicIps.Description: Boolean flag to use public IP's for instances. If false, the VPC must be correctly setup to use NAT for all traffic.

VolumeIOPS.Description: Number of IOPS for volume type io1. Not used for standard volumes.

PreInstallScript.Description: Preinstall script URL. This is run before any host configuration.

PostInstallScript.Description: Postinstall script URL. This is run before any host configuration.

ComputeWaitConditionCount.Description: Specific number of instances to wait for while creating the cluster

S3ReadResource.Description: S3 resource with read access from cfncluster nodes

S3ReadWriteResource.Description: Addtional policy document to be added to EC2 IAM role created and assigned to all nodes.

Placement.Description: Type of placement requird in cfncluster, it can either be cluster or compute.

PlacementGroup.Description: The name of an exisiting placement group

EncryptedEphemeral.Description: Boolean flag to encrypt local ephemeral drives. The keys are in-memory and non-recoverable.

PreInstallArgs.Description: Preinstall script args passed to the preinstall script.

PostInstallArgs.Description: Postinstall script args passed to the postinstall script.

EBSEncryption.Description: Boolean flag to use EBS encryption for /shared volume. (Not to be used for snapshots)

EphemeralDir.Description: The path/mountpoint for the ephemeral drive

BaseOS.Description: Base OS type for cluster AMI
BaseOS.ConstraintDescription: must be a supported base OS

ScalingThreshold2.Description: Threshold for triggering CloudWatch ScaleUp2 action

ScalingCooldown.Description: Period in seconds to wait before allowing further scaling actions

ScalingAdjustment.Description: Number of instances to add to cluster when the CloudWatch ScaleUp action is called.

ScalingAdjustment2.Description: Number of instances to add to cluster when the CloudWatch ScaleUp2 action is called.

SharedDir.Description: The path/mountpoint for the shared drive

AdditionalSG.Description: Additional VPC secuirty group to be added to instances. Defaults to NONE

Tenancy.Description: Type of placement requird in cfncluster, it can either be cluster or compute.

EBSKMSKeyId.Description: KMS ARN for customer created master key, will be used for EBS encryption

EphemeralKMSKeyId.Description: KMS ARN for customer created master key, will be used for ephemeral encryption

ClusterReadyScript.Description: Cluster ready script URL. This is only on the MasterServer, when the cluster reaches CREATE_COMPLETE.

MasterRootVolumeSize.Description: Size of MasterServer EBS root volume in GB

ComputeRootVolumeSize.Description: Size of ComputeFleet EBS root volume in GB

Fn::Join: || error_exit 'Failed to run cfn-init. If --norollback was specified, check /var/log/cfn-init.log and /var/log/cfncluster.log.'
-c /tmp/cwlogs/cfn-logs.conf || error_exit 'Failed to run CloudWatch Logs agent setup'
-c /tmp/cwlogs/cfn-logs.conf || error_exit 'Failed to run CloudWatch Logs agent setup'
-c /tmp/cwlogs/cfn-logs.conf || error_exit 'Failed to run CloudWatch Logs agent setup'

Properties.GroupDescription: Enable access to the Master host
Allow access to resources in subnets behind front

MasterPrivateIP.Description: Private IP Address of the Master host

MasterPublicIP.Description: Public IP Address of the Master host
